p: The DPPH (1,1-diphenyl-2-picrylhydrazyl) radical scavenging assay was performed in 96-well microplates according to the method described by Blois [ 22] with some modifications. Absorbance was recorded at 517 nm and trolox (12.5, 6.25, 3.12, 1.56, and 0.78 μg/mL) was used to construct the standard curve. Results were expressed as trolox equivalents antioxidant capacity (mg trolox equivalents per gram of extract) on a dry weight basis.
